restaurant

Class Meal

  • java.lang.Object
    • restaurant.Meal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FullMeal, HalfMeal

    public abstract class Meal
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Meal is the superClass of every possible combination of items, that are supposed to be a kind of meal (i.e. FullMeal, HalfMeal) A Meal-object always stores information about its status (glutenFree, vegetarian, mealOfTheWeek, discount, complete). For every meal, the method to check if an added item is glutenFree and/or vegetarian and modifies the status of the meal depending on that. Process to create a Meal : Creating of an empty meal. Adding singleItems to complete the meal.
    Author:
    maxspahn, jeremyaugot
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Meal

        public Meal(java.lang.String name)
        Constructor. Creates a empty new Meal with a given name.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public abstract void addItem(SingleItem item)
                      throws WrongItemAdded
        Adds an item to the meal, must be implemented for every kind of meal. Method must check if a given singleItem is valid for the meal (the type must not exist already). Sets the status to complete if all needed types (i.e. Starter) have been added.
        Parameters:
        item - SingleItem to add.
        Throws:
        WrongItemAdded

      • removeItem

        public abstract void removeItem(SingleItem item)
                         throws WrongItemRemoved
        Removes an item from the meal, must be implemented for every kind of meal. Method must check if a given singleItem is existant in the meal, otherwise it throws an Exception. Sets the status to incomplete.
        Parameters:
        item - SingleItem to remove
        Throws:
        WrongItemRemoved

      • checkVegieGluten

        public void checkVegieGluten(SingleItem item)
        Auxiliary method to check if an added item is vegetarian and/or glutenfree. If it is not the case the status of the meal is changed.
        Parameters:
        item - Newly added item.

      • getPrice

        public abstract double getPrice()
        Gets the price for the item. Is implemented differently for every meal type, in order to allow different discounts (instead of 5%).
        Returns:
        Price of the meal.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overriding to print a meal object. The components are displayed in different lines. The price is in the last line.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String with the information.
